description: Number of residue classes modulo n which contain a prime.
comments: a(n)=n iff n is prime; a(2*n)<=n+1; a(4*p)=2*p for primes p>2: a(A001749(n))=A057860(A001749(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 11 2004
example: a(30) = 11 since 30k+m can be prime if m = 2, 3 or 5 (once each with k = 0) or m = 1, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19, 23 or 29 (each for an infinite number of values of k)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Sep 08 2000
